title: Let's preview the 2025 NFL season: Bold predictions, strengths and concerns for all 32 teams
content: Here's everything you need to know ahead of the NFL regular season, including how teams rank before Week 1.

title: Simulating the entire season: The biggest storylines from one possible outcome
content: We played out one of the Football Power Index's 10,000 season sims, from Week 1 through Super Bowl LX.

title: Djokovic spars with US Open crowd, ousts Fritz
content: Novak Djokovic engaged in some back-and-forth with those in the crowd pulling for the last American man in the field as he advanced to a record-extending 53rd Grand Slam semifinal.

title: Valdez denies hitting Astros catcher on purpose
content: Astros starter Framber Valdez said he apologized to catcher Cesar Salazar after hitting him in the chest with a pitch Tuesday night, but the left-hander insisted it wasn't intentional.

title: 3 tossed from Giants-Rockies after Devers homer
content: The Rockies' Kyle Freeland along with the Giants' Matt Chapman and Willy Adames were ejected following a benches-clearing incident that started after Rafael Devers hit a two-run home run.

title: Ohtani belts 100th HR with Dodgers in record time
content: Shohei Ohtani hit his 100th home run with the Dodgers in his 294th game with the team, the fastest in franchise history.

title: Hold that, Tiger: Kelly asks if Dabo saw 2nd half
content: After Dabo Swinney gave his grades for Saturday's game -- "they made a 65; we made a 58" -- LSU's Brian Kelly questioned if the Clemson coach saw the second half.

title: McLean retires last 14, 1st Met to win 1st 4 starts
content: Nolan McLean became the first Mets pitcher to win his first four career starts, retiring the final 14 batters he faced in a 12-5 win over the Tigers on Tuesday.

title: Struggling Liberty clinch playoff spot despite loss
content: The Liberty clinched a playoff berth Tuesday night despite falling 66-58 to the Valkyries and were in no mood to celebrate as the team continues to struggle with only three games left in the regular season.

title: Sanders bites back over Buffs' clock management
content: A feisty Deion Sanders is pushing back against anyone second-guessing his clock management or calling out his coaching staff.

title: üìù Schefter's cheat sheet: Picks, sleepers to target
content: No one is more plugged in to the latest buzz around the NFL than Adam Schefter. We asked him to share his favorite values in fantasy drafts with you.

title: How the relationship between Micah Parsons and the Cowboys broke down
content: Micah Parsons wanted to be a Dallas Cowboy "for life." The disputed nature of a March meeting with Jerry Jones helped chart a course for his exit.

title: AP Week 1 poll reaction: What's next for each Top 25 team
content: College football came back in a big way this past weekend, with high-profile matchups and some surprise scores. Now it's time to look forward for the country's best teams.

title: WNBA Power Rankings: Best-case scenarios for all 13 teams to end the season
content: From home-court advantage in the first round to awards, here's what each team is playing for down the stretch.

title: Which teams will dominate September? Our MLB experts make final-month predictions
content: With less than a month left to play in the 2025 regular season, here's what our experts think will happen the rest of the way.

title: Welcome to September! Ranking the MLB playoff races that will rule the final month
content: Here's what you need to know about the battles to reach October as teams try to lock up a postseason spot.

title: Miami is awesome! Arch isn't! We overreact to Week 1
content: What happened to Arch Manning? And Clemson?? And Alabama??? We jump to some way-too-early conclusions.

title: 'Just getting started:' Why Lamar Jackson believes he can take his game to another level
content: Jackson is only a few months removed from one of the best seasons by a quarterback in NFL history, and he still expects to get better.

title: Worst transfers of the window, ranked: From Cunha to Isak, 13 big moves that might fail
content: This summer transfer window had its share of good moves, but we're ranking the 13 worst ones. Did Man United, Liverpool and Arsenal mess up?

title: How did Liverpool afford their $600 million summer of spending?
content: Liverpool won the Premier League title last season but went on a spending spree. Why? And how did they do it?

title: Way-Too-Early men's Top 25 rankings: Every team's top awards candidate
content: From Purdue's Braden Smith to NC State's Will Wade, we're on early awards watch for these candidates from Top 25 teams.

title: Why Dwight Howard absolutely belongs as a first-ballot Hall of Famer
content: The long, undistinguished final arc of Dwight Howard's career masks just how high he climbed at his peak.

title: Where the 2025 class stacks up for NBA, WNBA
content: Ahead of enshrinement weekend, let's take a closer look at where this year's class ranks in both leagues.

title: Five months from Olympics, here's what you should know about Team USA men's hockey
content: Will Matthew Tkachuk be healthy enough to play? Can Tage Thompson crack the lineup? We look at some of the biggest topics coming out of the recent orientation camp.

title: College football betting lines: Michigan heads to Oklahoma in ranked showdown
content: This week's odds and FPI predictions for Michigan-Oklahoma, Arizona State-Mississippi State and every Top 25 matchup.

title: College football betting: Should you bet on Garrett Nussmeier to win the Heisman?
content: As the odds shift each week for the Heisman Trophy, Pamela Maldonado explains how to bet each of them.

title: How Sam Darnold's one season with the 49ers prepared him for the Seahawks
content: Darnold's long NFL journey has led him to the Seahawks, but his transformative year was spent with thwe 49ers.

title: Buffalo Bills WR Khalil Shakir helps save 19 dogs from being euthanized
content: The Bills wide receiver helped local rescue, Nickel City Canine Rescue, with a transfer of dogs from Clarke County Animal Shelter.

title: How Oscar Piastri changed the fate of McLaren and Alpine
content: Three years ago, a court ruled that Oscar Piastri's move from Alpine to McLaren could go through. Now, he leads the drivers' championship while Alpine is dead last in the constructors'. What changed?

title: Backyard Football '99 re-release date announced for PC and mobile
content: The latest modernized edition of a Backyard Sports game will come to PC, iOS and Android this September.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United already working on Baleba deal
content: Manchester United are already working on a deal for Brighton & Hove Albion midfielder Carlos Baleba. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: MLS: Philadelphia jumps San Diego into top spot
content: Philadelphia Union's statement win over Cincinnati has the Union back on top of ESPN's MLS Power Rankings.

title: Canelo vs. Crawford: 10 big fights that define their careers
content: A look at both fighters' best performance, best KO, most dominant fight, the one where they struggled and more.

title: Weekly pickups: Jonah Tong, Payton Tolle lead fantasy playoff picks
content: The players you should claim off the waiver wire, including some pitchers to help you in the fantasy playoffs.

title: Gold Prices In India To Surge To Rs 125,000 By 2026: Report
content: Indian gold prices are expected to continue rising, trading in the range of Rs 99,500 to Rs 110,000 per ten grams over the rest of 2025, and moving higher to Rs 110,000 to Rs 125,000 in the first half of 2026, according to a research

title: Bihar's Woman Voter: Nitish Kumar's Silent Weapon, And NDA's Fresh Outreach
content: Elections in India are not won or lost just in political rallies, manifestos and social media chatter. At homes, kitchens and offices, a silent voter base discusses its choices and priorities in the run-up to polling day

title: GST Council Meeting: What May Get Cheaper Or Cost More Under New Slabs
content: High hopes ride on the 56th GST Council meeting as it takes up proposals to simplify slabs and slash rates on key goods and services.

title: 3 Killed, 22 Injured After Drunk Driver Crashes SUV Into Ganesh Procession In Chhattisgarh
content: Three persons were killed and 22 others suffered injuries when an SUV, driven by an inebriated person, ploughed into a religious procession in Chhattisgarh's Jashpur district, police said on Wednesday.

title: "Come Visit Us": Vladimir Putin Invites Kim Jong Un To Russia
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Wednesday invited North Korean leader Kim Jong Un to visit Russia after holding talks in Beijing with him, according to video published by the Kremlin.

title: 'Drunk' Lawyer Chants 'Har Har Mahadev' On Delhi-Kolkata IndiGo Flight, Chaos Erupts
content: Chaos erupted onboard a Delhi-Kolkata IndiGo flight on Monday after a drunk lawyer allegedly chanted religious slogans like "Har Har Mahadev" and urged fellow passengers to chant "Jai Shri Ram".

title: 5.2 Earthquake Hits Afghanistan Less Than 48 Hours After 1,400 Died In Quake
content: A fresh 5.2-magnitude earthquake hit the east of Afghanistan on Tuesday, jolting a region still struggling with the aftermath of a powerful quake at the weekend that killed 1,400 people.

title: "India Was Richest Country": Shashi Tharoor Recap As New Show Launched
content: Congress MP and author Shashi Tharoor has announced that the first part of his new show for RT, Imperial Receipts, has been launched.

title: Rainy Bliss vs Traffic Stress: Rain Revives Old Noida-Gurugram Rivalry
content: When it rains, it pours for Gurugram. The roads and neighbourhoods get waterlogged, the metro stations witness capacity crowds, and there's often kilometres-long gridlock.

title: Analysis: Who Gains, Loses From K Kavitha's Suspension From BRS Amid Family Feud
content: The suspension of Kalvakuntla Kavitha from the Bharat Rashtra Samithi (BRS) is more than a disciplinary footnote - it is a political earthquake rocking the party.

title: Foot Fetish Gone Wrong: US Woman Hit By SUV After Refusing To Let Man Smell Her Feet
content: A Florida man allegedly ran an SUV over a woman after she refused to let him smell her feet. The incident occurred on August 24 at around 2 pm at the Serena Hotel in Aventura, about 20 miles north of Miami, The NY Post reported.

title: The Importance Of Being Nitish Kumar In Bihar
content: To look at Nitish Kumar on the eve of another election (November 2025) -his eighth contest as chief ministerial face-is to witness a paradox.

title: GPS Interference Is On Rise. Here's What Can Be Done About It
content: GPS interference is on the rise, so you might be wondering how it works. And can anything be done about it? And  perhaps most importantly  do you need to worry?

title: More S-400s For India? Sources Say Delivery Expected To Begin Next Year
content: Russia is expected to start delivering more S-400 units, months after the air defence system emerged as an impenetrable shield for India during its war debut against Pakistan.

title: "Don't Have Inheritance": Elon Musk's Estranged Daughter Reveals She Lives With 3 Roommates
content: Vivian Wilson, the estranged daughter of Elon Musk, has revealed that she is broke and lives in an apartment with three roommates because it's cheaper.

title: Businessman Harsh Goenka's "Confused Desh Bhakt" Post, And A Dilemma
content: Industrialist Harsh Goenka on Tuesday recalled India's recurring boycott calls, describing himself as "a confused desh bhakt" while listing everything from Chinese goods to American fast food that he has given up.

title: Opinion: Opinion | RSS At 100: Contradictions Of Imagination
content: Bhagwat said that except for certain core tenets, everything in the RSS is open to change. That flexibility will be useful for the RSS leadership, which has its job cut out as it tries to steer the ship into open international waters.

title: "Punjab's Money For Punjab's People": Raghav Chadha Sends Rs 3.25 crore For Flood-Hit Villages
content: Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) MP, Raghav Chadha, on Wednesday announced sanctioning Rs 3.25 crore from his MPLADS funds, for providing assistance in relief and rehabilitation work in the flood-hit regions of Punjab.

title: Passport Relief For Pakistan, Afghanistan Minorities Who Came To India Till 2024
content: Members of minority communities from Afghanistan, Bangladesh and Pakistan -- Hindus, Sikhs, Buddhists, Jains, Parsis and Christians -- who came to India till December 31, 2024.

title: Maharashtra Man Kills Minor Fiancee After Fight, Arrested
content: A 22-year-old man allegedly strangulated his 17-year-old fiancee to death after a quarrel in Maharashtra's Palghar district, police said on Wednesday.

title: Punjab declared disaster-hit state: Over 1,200 villages submerged in worst floods
content: Punjab faces its worst floods in decades, declared a disaster-affected state, with over 1,200 villages impacted and lakhs of people affected. Authorities are implementing emergency measures, including restoring essential services and ensuring uninterrupted connectivity. Extensive farmland is submerged, causing devastating crop losses, and livestock has been lost, severely impacting rural households. Water levels in major dams are dangerously high.

title: Kim Jong Un‚Äôs 13-year old daughter makes international debut appearance
content: Kim Jong Un's daughter, believed to be Ju Ae, made her first public appearance abroad in Beijing, sparking speculation about her potential succession. South Korean intelligence suggests she is the leading candidate, despite doubts about a female ruler in the dynasty. Ju Ae has been increasingly visible at high-profile events, hinting at a growing role within the regime.

title: 'Without US, world will die': Trump hails America as 'hottest, best'
content: Donald Trump asserted the US economy's strength under his leadership, attributing it to tariffs while criticizing India's trade practices, citing Harley-Davidson as an example. He claimed India imposes high tariffs while benefiting from minimal barriers in the US market. Trump also reiterated claims of settling wars, including averting potential nuclear conflict between India and Pakistan, amid strained US-India relations.

title: Delhi flood alert: In 63 years, Yamuna breached 207m only in four rainy seasons
content: The Yamuna River in Delhi has surged past the danger mark, displacing over 10,000 people across 28 locations. Water levels are expected to rise further, potentially breaching a 63-year high. Increased water discharge from Haryana's Hathnikund barrage is exacerbating the situation, leading to traffic diversions and concerns about prolonged flooding in low-lying areas.

title: Culture at Microsoft: Satya Nadella to employees; 'This is what he wants them to do'
content: Amidst significant AI transformation and workforce restructuring, Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella has urged employees to embrace a "growth mindset." He emphasized the importance of continuous learning and improvement as the company shifts towards becoming an "intelligence engine." Nadella framed these challenges as career-defining opportunities, encouraging employees to connect personal growth with Microsoft's global mission.

title: 'Age just a number': 39-yr Sikandar Raza; 35-yr Keshav Maharaj take top ICC spots
content: Sikandar Raza, at 39, has achieved the number one all-rounder ranking in ICC Men‚Äôs ODI, driven by consistent performances with both bat and ball during the series against Sri Lanka. Despite Zimbabwe's series loss, Raza's individual brilliance stood out, highlighted by back-to-back half-centuries and impactful bowling.

title: Is Trump being ironic? Russia rejects 'conspiracy against US' charge on Putin, Xi, Kim
content: Russia refuted Donald Trump's claim that Vladimir Putin, Kim Jong Un, and Xi Jinping were conspiring against the US during a Beijing military parade. The Kremlin dismissed Trump's accusation as potentially ironic, emphasizing that no such conspiracy existed among the leaders. Xi Jinping's address highlighted a global choice between peace and war during the parade.

title: UP woman hid 27-year age gap; killed by lover after marriage pressure
content: Arun Rajput, a 25-year-old truck driver from Mainpuri, has been arrested for allegedly strangling his 52-year-old lover, Rani Devi, after discovering her true age and facing pressure to marry her. Rani, who concealed her age using social media filters, had an affair with Arun, during which he allegedly took Rs 1.5 lakh from her.

title: ChatGPT down: Thousands of users report outage; both web & app versions hit
content: ChatGPT is currently experiencing a global outage, leaving thousands of users unable to access the AI chatbot. Reports indicate widespread issues with both the web and app versions, with users encountering a 'ChatGPT Not Displaying Responses' error. OpenAI has acknowledged the problem and is actively investigating the cause of the disruption.

title: After Bengaluru techie death, another woman dies of 'dowry harassment'
content: Bengaluru police are investigating the alleged suicide of 28-year-old Poojashree, a mother of a 10-month-old, following a complaint filed by her mother. The complaint alleges repeated dowry harassment and an extramarital affair involving her husband, Nandish. Poojashree reportedly faced physical and mental abuse when she confronted him, despite family interventions. A case has been registered, and the investigation is underway.

title: Is G FUEL really shutting down? Brand‚Äôs viral ‚Äúend of an era‚Äù post sparks confusion
content: G FUEL, the popular energy drink among gamers, has sparked widespread speculation with a cryptic message on X, hinting at the "end of an era." The post, thanking fans for their support, led to concerns about a potential shutdown. However, rumors of a major rebrand, including a new logo and updated formula, are also circulating.

title: K Kavitha resigns from BRS; quits MLC seat a day after suspension
content: K Kavitha, recently suspended from BRS, alleges a conspiracy against her by certain party leaders. She claims hostility and accuses detractors of targeting her for raising crucial issues. Kavitha expressed disappointment over lack of support from her brother, KT Rama Rao, during a malicious campaign.

title: Youngest woman billionaire on leaving college; parents reaction; money lessons
content: Lucy Guo, the youngest self-made billionaire, attributes her success to her frugal upbringing and early entrepreneurial spirit. Despite disappointing her immigrant parents by dropping out of Carnegie Mellon, she pursued the Thiel Fellowship and founded successful ventures like Scale AI and Passes.

title: Delhi Jan Sunwai: CM Rekha Gupta holds first programme after attack
content: Delhi CM Rekha Gupta resumed her public hearing program, Jan Sunwai, amidst heightened security following a recent attack. Citizens gathered to present grievances, with Gupta assuring swift action. Security measures included frisking, CCTV surveillance, and a protective police ring. Gupta emphasized the importance of public service and resolving citizen issues, directing officials to address concerns promptly.

title: Smoke-emitting chopper missing in Indonesia mountains; Indian among 8 onboard
content: An Indonesian helicopter, carrying eight passengers including an Indian national, Santha Kumar, crashed in a mountainous region after emitting white smoke. Contact was lost on Monday morning. A teacher reported seeing the helicopter flying low and releasing smoke. Search and rescue teams are conducting aerial and ground operations, facing challenges due to heavy rainfall and dense forest.

title: 'We'll find our strength again': RCB captain breaks silence on stampede tragedy
content: RCB captain Rajat Patidar addressed fans following the tragic stampede after their IPL victory parade, expressing condolences and solidarity. Virat Kohli echoed these sentiments, acknowledging the heartbreak and offering prayers. RCB announced a compensation package, a memorial, and safety measures, while a judicial commission held organisers responsible for safety lapses.

title: Gauahar Khan and Zaid Darbar welcome baby boy: ‚ÄúZehaan is overjoyed to welcome his brother‚Äù
content: Gauahar Khan and Zaid Darbar joyfully announced the arrival of their second son, born on September 1st. Their firstborn, Zehaan, is excited to share his world with his new baby brother. The couple expressed their gratitude and requested continued blessings for their growing family, receiving an outpouring of love and congratulations from fans and industry colleagues.

title: Riots ‚Äòconspiracy‚Äô: No bail for Umar, Sharjeel
content: The Delhi High Court denied bail to Umar Khalid, Sharjeel Imam, and seven others in the 2020 Delhi riots "larger conspiracy" case, asserting that freedom of speech cannot justify conspiratorial violence. The court emphasized that while citizens have the right to protest peacefully, such rights are not absolute and must be exercised within legal boundaries.

title: Vivek Agnihotri says he convinced Javed Akhtar to keep ‚ÄòBillo Rani‚Äô song
content: Vivek Agnihotri, known for films like 'The Kashmir Files,' revealed he convinced Javed Akhtar to retain 'Billo Rani' in the song from 'Dhan Dhana Dhan Goal.' Despite differing political views, Agnihotri deeply respects Akhtar's intellect and acknowledges his contributions to Indian cinema, particularly his lyrics in 'Lagaan' and screenwriting that shaped Amitabh Bachchan's iconic roles.

title: Irfan Pathan and MS Dhoni: The hookah controversy explained
content: Irfan Pathan's old interview resurfaced, reigniting discussions about his relationship with MS Dhoni. Pathan hinted at a lack of communication regarding his exclusion from the national team.

title: 'We'll get your delivery done elsewhere': Congress MLA Deshpande winks at journalist
content: Senior Congress MLA RV Deshpande faced backlash for his insensitive remarks to a woman journalist regarding the lack of a hospital in Joida taluk. When questioned about the urgent need for medical facilities, especially for pregnant women, Deshpande responded with a wink, suggesting her delivery could be arranged elsewhere, sparking condemnation from the BJP who criticized his disrespect towards women.

title: GST council meeting: What will become cheaper after rate cuts?
content: The 56th GST Council meeting, presided over by Nirmala Sitharaman, is set to introduce significant changes to India's indirect taxation framework. The council is considering consolidating GST rates, potentially eliminating the 12% and 28% categories, and shifting items to 5% or 18% brackets.

title: 'IPL, then 10 games in 10 months': Ex-cricketer questions Kohli-Rohit
content: Aakash Chopra questioned Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma's decisions to retire from Test cricket while continuing in ODIs, suggesting they could aim for the 2027 World Cup. He felt their reduced game time is a concern and believed Kohli's legacy will be judged on batting records, noting the absence of ICC trophies under his captaincy.

title: Over 500 drones: Russia launches attack on western Ukraine; many injured
content: Russia launched a massive aerial assault on Ukraine, deploying over 500 aerial weapons, primarily targeting western regions. Ukrainian officials reported injuries and damage to residential areas and infrastructure. The overnight attack injured railway workers, prompting Poland to activate its defense aircraft.

title: No Bronco Test for India cricketers yet; could happen in Dubai
content: Indian cricketers, including Rohit Sharma, recently underwent fitness assessments at the BCCI's Centre of Excellence in Bengaluru following a break. While the Yo-Yo test was conducted, the Bronco drill, recommended by Strength & Conditioning coach Adrian Le Roux, was absent but might be included during the Asia Cup in Dubai.

title: 'Hydrogen bomb in Varanasi': Rahul's next vote theft 'expose' may be on PM Modi's seat
content: Uttar Pradesh Congress chief Ajay Rai suggests Rahul Gandhi may expose alleged vote theft in Varanasi, hinting at a potential 'hydrogen bomb' revelation. This follows Gandhi's claim of an 'atom bomb' expose in Bengaluru and accusations against the Election Commission and BJP regarding vote manipulation. Modi's victory margin in Varanasi was notably lower this election.

title: Virat Kohli on Bengaluru stampede: 'Nothing prepares you for heartbreak like June 4th'
content: Virat Kohli has addressed the tragic stampede outside M Chinnaswamy Stadium that resulted in 11 deaths and 75 injuries, calling it a heartbreaking event following RCB's IPL victory. RCB will provide Rs 25 lakh compensation to the victims' families and establish a memorial. A judicial report held organizers responsible for SOP violations, deeming the venue unsafe.

title: 'Bring India tariffs to zero and apologise‚Äô: US analyst urges Trump amid trade war
content: Edward Price, a US analyst, criticizes President Trump's tariffs on India, advocating for their removal and an apology. He emphasizes the crucial role of the US-India relationship in the 21st century, particularly in relation to China and Russia. Price also acknowledges concerns about Trump's potential financial interests influencing US-India relations, while praising PM Modi's strategic independence.

title: 'Warmest regards to Putin, Kim as you conspire against US': Trump on China parade
content: Donald Trump criticized China as Beijing held a large military parade attended by Vladimir Putin and Kim Jong Un. Trump claimed American workers sacrificed their lives for China's freedom, urging recognition of their bravery. He then accused Beijing of conspiring against the U.S., sending regards to Putin and Kim.

title: FDA announces recall of popular Ice Cream brand due to undeclared hidden ingredients
content: The product recall occurred because of a packaging mistake, which resulted in incorrect labeling. The recall affects Friendly‚Äôs Ice Cream Vanilla Bean flavor, which comes in specific carton sizes. The packaging mistake resulted in Vanilla Bean ice cream containers receiving Cookies & Cream ice cream, instead of their intended contents. The product labels do not show the presence of soy and wheat allergens which are major food allergens

title: 'Never intimidated by any bullies': Xi flaunts China's might with Putin, Kim Jong Un
content: President Xi Jinping, alongside Putin and Kim Jong Un, showcased China's military might, sending a strong message to the US. Xi affirmed China's rise and warned of a choice between peace and confrontation. Trump responded by accusing the leaders of conspiring against the US, while also highlighting America's support for China during World War II.

title: CBSE warns schools: Sloppy data checks blamed; delays warned
content: The Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) has issued a circular tightening rules for correcting Class 10 and 12 students‚Äô demographic details. Highlighting repeated lapses by schools, CBSE has mandated strict verification during admission, registration, and LOC submission. Incomplete or undocumented requests will now be rejected, placing accountability on schools and parents to ensure 100% accurate student records before results.

title: Why plastic-filled Neptune balls are washing up on beaches: Explained
content: Mediterranean beaches reveal a hidden battle against plastic pollution through Neptune balls, formed by seagrass. These natural bundles trap significant amounts of plastic, highlighting the crucial role of seagrass meadows in combating ocean waste. Protecting these vital ecosystems is essential for both biodiversity and mitigating the impact of plastic pollution.

title: Gurgaon's night of mayhem: Rs 600 for 6km! Water seige not over
content: Gurgaon was paralyzed by torrential rains, revealing both the city's vulnerabilities and its residents' resilience. Commuters faced flooded roads, exorbitant e-rickshaw fares, and abandoned vehicles. Amidst the chaos, stories of kindness emerged, like a Rapido driver's unwavering patience during a seven-hour traffic jam. While many struggled, some found creative solutions, chartering mini-trucks to navigate the flooded streets.

title: Red alert today: IMD issues warning in J&K, Punjab, Himachal for heavy rain
content: The India Meteorological Department issued red alerts for multiple districts across northern India due to continuing heavy rainfall, forecasting flash floods and landslides. Jammu & Kashmir, Punjab, Himachal Pradesh, Haryana, and other states experienced significant downpours, with Reasi recording extremely heavy rainfall. Consequently, schools in the Jammu Division will remain closed on September 3rd for safety reasons.

title: Booster shot! Services sector PMI hits 15-year high; surges to 62.9
content: India's services sector experienced its strongest expansion in 15 years in August, fueled by robust demand and increased international orders, as indicated by the HSBC India Services PMI. New business surged, supported by rising export orders across Asia, Europe, the Middle East, and the US.

title: Delhi launches nutrition drive: 6,000+ covered; students drive effort
content: A newly launched school nutrition education programme in Delhi is set to benefit over 6,000 people, including 1,500 children. Implemented across six schools, it integrates food literacy into classrooms with games, toolkits, and teacher training. Students are being empowered as ambassadors of healthy living, driving a healthier future for their communities.

title: Price prediction today: Gold, silver rates hit life-time highs. Where are they headed?
content: Gold price prediction today: Gold prices are expected to trade sideways with a bullish bias, potentially reaching new highs amid safe-haven demand and expectations of a Fed rate cut. Silver is predicted to continue its bull run. Geopolitical tensions and concerns over the Fed's independence are also supporting gold's upward trajectory, making any dips potential buying opportunities for investors.

title: Why NFL‚Äôs Friday opener won‚Äôt happen in 2026 despite record-breaking TV numbers
content: In 2026, the NFL will break its recent tradition of opening Week 1 with a Friday night game due to the Sports Broadcasting Act of 1961, which protects high school and college football. While the Friday opener disappears, the NFL is expanding its international presence, beginning the season with a historic game in Australia.

title: Shaquille O‚ÄôNeal surprises wrestler Tamara Humphries after her transportation struggles
content: Shaquille O'Neal gifted Tamara Humphries, an 18-year-old wrestler from Pittsburgh, a brand new 2025 Mitsubishi Outlander after learning about her transportation struggles. Humphries, a freshman at the University of Pittsburgh at Johnstown, was finding it difficult to attend practices and tournaments. O'Neal's generous act, sparked by Humphries' social media posts, highlights his commitment to giving back and supporting young athletes.

title: Mayo Clinic study reveals shocking truth: We are living longer, but not healthier
content: A global study reveals a widening gap between lifespan and healthspan, indicating people are living longer but spending more years in poor health. This disparity, approximately nine years worldwide, is influenced by factors like chronic diseases in wealthier regions and infectious diseases in poorer areas. Tailored health policies are crucial to improve the quality of life during extended lifespans.

title: UK car crash: 2 Hyderabad students dead, 5 hurt after Ganesh immersion
content: Tragedy struck as two Hyderabad students, Chaitanya Tarre and Rishiteja Rapu, lost their lives in a car collision in Essex, UK, early Monday. The accident, involving two cars carrying nine Indian students returning from a Ganesh idol immersion, left five others injured.

title: Frontier Airlines‚Äô GoWild! offer: Unlimited travel pass for $299 launched
content: Frontier Airlines is offering its GoWild! unlimited travel pass for a limited time at $299, valid from September 2-5, 2025. This pass allows passengers to book unlimited domestic and international flights for just a penny plus taxes and fees. Purchasers also receive a complimentary GoWild! pass valid immediately and another for 2026-27, offering 20 months of travel.

title: 'Was posting reels frequently': Delhi man strangles wife
content: In Delhi's Najafgarh, Aman allegedly killed his wife Rajni due to disagreements over her social media activity. He then tried to commit suicide. Neighbours found Rajni dead and Aman unconscious. Police arrived and took Aman to the hospital. He is now in custody. Rajni had thousands of followers on Instagram. The couple often fought about her online presence.

title: 'One year waiting list to meet Premanand ji Maharaj', reveals Raj Kundra
content: Anushka Sharma and Virat Kohli's devotion to Premanand Ji Maharaj is well-known, and recently Raj Kundra and Shilpa Shetty also visited him. Raj Kundra, deeply moved by the guru's resilience while undergoing dialysis, pledged to donate a kidney. Despite facing trolls, Kundra remains steadfast in his decision, emphasizing his personal choice and the guru's profound impact.

title: Congress leader Pawan Khera's wife also has two active voter ID cards, alleges BJP
content: This comes a day after the ruling BJP alleged that Mr. Khera had two voter IDs and Mr. Gandhi was running a campaign against voter-roll revision in Bihar to "protect and hide" his party's theft of votes.

title: Delhi HC denies bail to man impersonating as Amit Shah‚Äôs nephew, cheating businessman
content: The man allegedly assured the complainant that get a ‚Çπ90 crore tender from the central government for the supply of leather for renovating the President‚Äôs estate

title: PMK‚Äôs Disciplinary Action Committee to send second show-cause notice to Anbumani Ramadoss
content: Speaking to reporters at his Thailapuram residence on Wednesday, PMK founder S. Ramadoss said the Administrative Committee had unanimously decided to grant time till September 10 to Mr. Anbumani to respond to the notice

title: Satheesan non-committal on Rahul Mamkootathil‚Äôs attendance in Assembly
content: Opposition leader says UDF will take ‚Äúappropriate decision at the appropriate time‚Äù ahead of September 15 session

title: Elgar Parishad case: Supreme Court defers Surendra Gadling bail plea to September 17
content: A Bench comprising Justices J.K. Maheshwari and K. Vinod Chandran deferred the matter after Additional Solicitor General S.V. Raju sought time

title: Mizoram residents hope the new Bairabi-Sairang line brings seamless changes into their life
content: Travel time between Silchar and Aizawl to be cut from 8-10 hours by road to under four hours by train

title: India to test battery storage at coal plants to balance grid as solar power surges
content: CEA chairman Ghanshyam Prasad said that coal power generator NTPC had been tasked with testing this at some plants and given funding support

title: Maratha protest: Quota petitioner calls Government Resolution ‚Äòcompletely useless‚Äô
content: The truth is, not a single certificate will come out of this GR. I have fought a legal battle for the community, and I can say with certainty that those without documentary proof of Kunbi lineage will never gain anything, says Activist Vinod Patil

title: India‚Äôs first vulture conservation portal launched in Assam
content: An Assam-based foundation developed the portal to compile scientific information, spread awareness, and provide free downloadable outreach materials

title: Supreme Court raps Sukesh Chandrasekhar‚Äôs wife plea seeking expeditious hearing in Delhi High Court
content: A Bench of Justices Dipankar Datta and Prashant Kumar Mishra said the tendency of approaching the apex court for seeking an early hearing of cases is not acceptable

title: 3 foreigners got Indian citizenship in Assam under CAA: Himanta
content: We have received only 12 applications so far. The remaining nine applications are under consideration, says Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma

title: A 100 years of the Self-Respect Movement in Tamil Nadu
content: Social reformer ‚ÄòPeriyar‚Äô E.V. Ramasamy, through the launch of Tamil weekly Kudi Arasu (Republic), paved way for the formal beginning of the Self-Respect Movement

title: Gurugram STF arrests Haryana's most wanted gangster Mainpal Badli
content: Mainpal was detained in Cambodia about 10 days ago and was caught by a joint team of central agencies and Gurugram STF under a secret operation.

title: How can friendship be proved through documentary evidence, asks Madras High Court in case on kidney transplant
content: Justice N. Anand Venkatesh sets aside an authorisation committee‚Äôs order denying permission for renal transplantation because the donor and recipient could not produce proof of being family friends

title: IMD issues red alert in J&K, Punjab, Himachal Pradesh and other states
content: The India Meteorological Department¬†issues red alert warnings for multiple Indian states due to heavy rainfall, posing risks of floods and landslides

title: Modi govt won't rest till all Naxals surrender, caught or eliminated: Amit Shah
content: Mr. Shah said the bravery and valour displayed by the jawans during Operation Black Forest will be remembered as a ‚Äúgolden chapter in the history of anti-Naxal operations‚Äù

title: Air India Express flight to Sharjah stranded in Tiruchi after technical snag
content: The flight, scheduled to depart at 4.25 a.m. with 176 passengers on board, was about to take off when the crew detected a problem

title: Torrential rains across J&K; 2 killed in house collapse, major roads closed
content: Significant overnight rainfall was recorded in most parts of Jammu region with Reasi experiencing the highest 203 mm of rainfall till 8.30 am followed by Katra (193 mm), Batote in Ramban (157.3 mm), Doda (114 mm), Banihal (95 mm), Jammu (81 mm), Ramban (82 mm), Rajouri (57.4 mm) and Kishtwar (50 mm).

title: Yamuna level in Delhi continues to rise, evacuation underway
content: The reason for the rising water level is mostly due to the high volumes of water released from the Wazirabad and Hathnikund barrages every hour, says an official from the Central Flood Control Room.

title: Karnataka Bhovi Development Corporation Chairperson Ravi Kumar says he will resign in view of allegations of corruption
content: Regarding the video clip that went viral, Mr. Ravi Kumar stated that video clip was doctored and artificial intelligence tools had been used as part of the conspiracy

title: Presidential Reference hearing LIVE: ‚ÄòThe argument that President, Governors have discretion is fundamentally flawed,‚Äô Karnataka counsel tells SC
content: While the Centre argued that a political, and not a judicial solution, is needed to tackle delay in grant assent to Bills, West Bengal insists on time limit as Governors can‚Äôt withhold bills indefinitely.

title: Rahul Gandhi urges PM Modi to announce special relief package for flood-affected States
content: In such difficult times, your attention and the active help of the central government are extremely necessary. Thousands of families are struggling to save their homes, lives and loved ones, says Congress leader Rahul Gandhi

title: ‚ÄòCan‚Äôt allow Trump‚Äôs ego to destroy strategic relationship with India‚Äô: U.S. lawmaker Ro Khanna
content: Khanna explained that PM Modi‚Äôs refusal to nominate Donald Trump for a Nobel Peace Prize, while Pakistan did, has led to strained relations

title: Jagan pays tributes to YSR on his death anniversary
content: Later, he visits Duggannagaripalli and interacts with onion and citrus farmers, and slams Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu of not providing them minimum support price

title: Additional 53,000 MT urea reaches Andhra Pradesh ports
content: With record allocations, farmers will face no fertiliser shortage during the current kharif and upcoming rabi seasons, say officials

title: Tamil Nadu CM Stalin arrives in the U.K.
content: Mr. Stalin will address the Self-Respect Movement centenary conference and unveil Periyar‚Äôs portrait at University of Oxford

title: CRDA to acquire 1,800 acres in Amaravati for capital development
content: Municipal Administration Minister Narayana appeals to farmers to part with lands under LPS as it fetches them higher long-term benefits than land acquisition

title: How dead birds, old maps are helping scientists track biodiversity loss
content: A new study‚Äôs methods highlight the sort of innovation researchers can resort to in order to elicit new ecological and conservation wisdom. While field-based studies remain invaluable to understand the natural history of a habitat or species, data collected decades ago provides historical context to current biodiversity baselines

title: When a historic election in 1977 turned Tamil Nadu‚Äôs political landscape bipolar
content: The year has always been a source of attraction to many in Tamil Nadu, be they from politics or the cinema. Actor Vijay‚Äôs Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam (TVK), which is planning to enter the electoral fray in 2026, has been fancying 1977, apart from 1967.

title: SC orders DISCOMs to clear their regulatory assets | Explained
content: If the regulatory assets reported by DISCOMs operating in Delhi are to be recovered within the four-year window set by the apex court, they need to recover about Rs 16,580 crore a year

title: When Tamil Nadu Chief Minister Annadurai enthralled students at Yale University
content: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister M.K. Stalin is scheduled to deliver address at the University of Oxford in the United Kingdom to mark the centenary of the Self-Respect Movement on September 4, 2025

title: Supreme Court Collegium proposes appointment of 26 new judges to Allahabad High Court
content: The Collegium, in two separate proposals, has recommended 14 judicial officers and 12 advocates, the latter batch of which include two senior women lawyers from the Supreme Court Bar¬†

title: J&K Opposition parties express dismay over constructing Police Martyrs‚Äô building on 70-year-old playground in Srinagar
content: PDP leader and Pulwama MLA Waheed-ur-Rehman Parra said the land for the Police Martyrs‚Äô building has been a playground for 70 years; JKAP president Syed Altaf Bukhari termed the police‚Äôs move as ‚Äúdeeply concerning‚Äù

title: U.P. government orders probe into lathi charge on ABVP activists in Barabanki, CO removed
content: The incident happened on Monday (September 1, 2025) when ABVP workers and students staged a protest at the Shri Ram Swaroop Memorial University in Barabanki, alleging that the university is accepting admissions in LLB course even after its recognition was cancelled

title: Behind Maratha quota issue resolution, a climbdown by both the Mahayuti government and the activist
content: Over the last few days, the Cabinet subcommittee on Maratha reservation held four meetings. Drafts for the orders were kept ready, but the government maintained that it was firm on finding a constitutional solution to the deadlock

title: Hyderabad launches cyber innovation hub to strengthen digital security
content: The initiative, housed within IIIT Hyderabad campus, spans more than 3,000 square feet and is equipped with specialised tools and infrastructure dedicated to cybersecurity

title: Consumer Commission comes down heavily on LIC
content: The bench strongly criticised LIC for attempting to repudiate claims while being willing to issue policies to vulnerable clients

title: Student anger spills over as SFI stages protests over pending fee reimbursement¬†
content: According to SFI State committee, the State government owes ‚Çπ8,158 crore dues towards RTF in the past six years

title: 27 villages declared ‚Äòsensitive‚Äô in Faridabad as Yamuna water rises
content: Residents of a few villages have already¬†shifted to safer locations identified¬†by the authorities after floodwaters entered their homes.

title: Faridabad Deputy Commissioner visits ‚Äòsensitive‚Äô villages, urges residents to shift to safe homes due to rising water levels
content: Deputy Commissioner Vikram Singh visited the sensitive villages to take stock of the situation and made an appeal to the villagers to shift to the safe homes built by the administration in time

title: Disciplinary action initiated against 94 Excise officials for dereliction of duty
content: A digital system was being implemented in the Department, and permission has been given to renew the license online once every 5 years: Minister

title: Karnataka High Court stays NMC‚Äôs action; permits admission for MBBS course in Jawaharlal Nehru Medical College in Belagavi for 2025-26
content: THe High Court of Karnataka has stayed the National Medical Commission‚Äôs decision of not permitting students to the first-year MBBS course for 2025-26 in the Jawaharlal Nehru Medical College, Belagavi, based on bribery allegations

title: BJP delegation asks BC commission to drop Christian sub-castes listed for survey in Karnataka
content: The BJP urged the Karnataka State Commission for Backward Classes, headed by Madhusudan R. Naik, to drop Christian ‚Äòsub castes‚Äô listed in the draft list of castes ahead of the socio-educational survey of the State population

title: Madras High Court reserves orders on Devanathan Yadav‚Äôs bail plea in Mylapore Hindu Permanent Fund Nidhi Ltd case
content: Justice G. Jayachandran wonders how the finance company will recover dues from its borrowers if EOW keeps it sealed for over one year

title: Army Vehicle intercepted by Kolkata Police for reckless driving
content: The incident occurred at about 11 a.m. on Tuesday (September 2, 2025) and the military truck was stopped by Kolkata Police after it came close to the vehicle of Kolkata Police Commissioner Manoj Kumar Verma

title: Bihar Cabinet approves plan to open seven medical colleges across seven districts
content: Bihar Cabinet sanctions ‚Çπ20,000 crore to roll out Mukhya Mantri Mahila Rozgar Yojana, approves the creation of 3,233 posts in different government departments, among other major decisions

title: Arundhati Roy‚Äôs memoir Mother Mary Comes to Me launched in Kochi
content: The event saw discussions on her new book, how it came to be, and touched on the childhood events that shaped the writer.

title: CBI arrests two persons in ‚Äòreverse trap‚Äô case
content: ‚ÄúIn a commendable act of integrity, the Superintendent in GST Intelligence played a pivotal role in the CBI operation that led to the arrest of two private individuals on bribery charge,‚Äù a CBI official said

title: West Bengal Assembly debates harassment on Bengali speaking migrants in other States
content: Minister Chandrima Bhattacharya said that the national anthem is written in Bengali and no person in the country can deny that

title: New era for Bengaluru as five corporations replace 18-year-old BBMP
content: Deputy Chief Minister D.K. Shivakumar said that each corporation will be divided into two zones. While a commissioner will head the corporation, they will be assisted by joint commissioners, with deputy commissioners heading each zone.

title: West Bengal LOP suspended from Assembly for creating ruckus in the House
content: Suvendu Adhikari raised objections to a remark by State‚Äôs Education Minister Bratya Basu directed at Army during a debate in the House

title: Karnataka forms delimitation committee to redraw wards for Bengaluru‚Äôs five new corporations
content: Each corporation can have a maximum of 150 wards, and the committee must strive to maintain population balance across them.

title: Governors cannot sit over Bills endlessly, say Supreme Court judges
content: Chief Justice of India B.R. Gavai and Justices Vikram Nath and P.S. Narasimha separately remark that Governors could neither delay the wisdom of the legislature indefinitely nor impede the functioning of the Constitution; Tamil Nadu and West Bengal seek collaboration, not combat, among high offices

title: BJP‚Äôs women leaders slam Opposition over insults to Modi‚Äôs mother
content: The pain felt by the PM is also being perceived by the people of Bihar and the entire country, says Nirmala Sitharaman, demanding an apology from Congress leader Rahul Gandhi and RJD‚Äôs Tejashwi Yadav

title: Singapore Prime Minister begins 3-day visit to India
content: Lawrence Wong will hold talks with Modi, Jaishankar, Pradhan; External Affairs Ministry says the visit will provide an opportunity to review the robust relation between the two countries

title: Foreigners Tribunals can issue arrest warrants, send ‚Äòforeigners‚Äô to detention centres
content: A new order gives Foreigners Tribunals powers of a first class judicial magistrate; it bars foreigners from taking jobs in the fields of defence, nuclear energy and human rights

title: COP-30 to focus on known solutions, says its President
content: The UN Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC) will hold its 30th Conference of Parties (COP-30) in November, in the Brazilian port city of Belem, a gateway to the Amazonian rainforest.

title: Hindus should avoid Halal meat to protect Sanatana Dharma: Giriraj Singh

title: Steamrolling ethanol-blended petrol puts seasoned mechanic, customers in trouble
content: Use of ethanol-blended petrol (E-20) is causing mechanical issues in the functioning of fuel system, including carburettor and engine, of vehicles

title: CPI State-level conference passes 11 resolutions
content: The party urges the State Election Commission to conduct polls to local bodies every five years without fail

title: Karnataka government issues notification for buffer zones around drains in Bengaluru
content: For primary drains, the buffer zone should be 15 metres on either side from the edge of the drain/nala, for secondary and tertiary drains, it is 10 metres and 5 metres respectively

title: Diamondbacks lose Gurriel; A's still waiting on Kurtz

title: Expectations dashed, Manning and Belichick need to rebuild
content: quarterbacks Peyton and Eli Manning won 10 of the 18 Super Bowls from 2001-2019 . belichick, 73, was trying to reinvent himself as a college coach at north Carolina . he was set to take over at Texas as the next generation of the family business, quarterbacking .

title: Updated SP+ rankings for all 136 FBS teams
content: in a single sentence, it's a tempo- and opponent-adjusted measure of college football efficiency . it does not automatically give credit for big wins or particularly brave scheduling . early in the season, ratings are based primarily on preseason projections .

title: Stafford embarking on Year 17, will he -- and his back -- make the most of it?
